channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ Georgia Institute of Technology on HF Daily Paper Reviews by AI

item.title: Large Language Models Think Too Fast To Explore Effectively
item.description: Large language models underperform humans in open-ended exploration due to prioritizing immediate choices over long-term strategic thinking, but innovative models show promise.

item.title: Virus: Harmful Fine-tuning Attack for Large Language Models Bypassing Guardrail Moderation
item.description: Virus: A new attack method easily bypasses LLM guardrails, highlighting the inadequacy of current safety measures and urging for more robust solutions.

item.title: Gaze-LLE: Gaze Target Estimation via Large-Scale Learned Encoders
item.description: Gaze-LLE achieves state-of-the-art gaze estimation by using a frozen DINOv2 encoder and a lightweight decoder, simplifying architecture and improving efficiency.
